channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Debris, 1st July
item.description:
Open reach have left tree branch and tree debris in road along with their plastic water bottle all dumped and left parking is not possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lullingstone Crescent, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge obstructing pavement, 1st July
item.description:
Pavement difficult to navigate outside 10 West Bank and front garden hedge is overgrown. Also has thick brambles crossing path at face height causing a hazard. It is also making it difficult to get bikes out of the cycle hanger.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): West Bank, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Load of litter been left by the local drug users please clear up, 1st July
item.description:
Load of litter been left by the local drug users please clear up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Market Meadow, Poverest, London

item.title: Massive tree blocking house sunlight, pavement causing obstruction, 1st July
item.description:
The massive Tree is blocking my pavement , blocking the public pavement, blocking and growing towards the windows and almost touching it. The trees are blocking all sunlight. My adjacent neighbours are also complaining. The roots are also causing an uneven surface pathway. Someone from the council said they will come cut back the trees. This is still to be actioned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Friern Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Overflowing street bin outside school

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 145, Charlton Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Stop Lazy Hackney Grass Cutters Chewing Up Litter and Spreading It All Over Our Garden, 1st July
item.description:
Stop your lazy, negligent groundsmen from using their grass cutting machines, to shred plastic & metal litter, break glass bottles, & then spread them all over our communal garden? BEFORE they cut the grass, they've got to REMOVE the litter, NOT cut it up
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mabley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox next to grave yard, opposite car park, 1st July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Bin waste tipped in street and not picked up Bryanston Mews West entry, 1st July
item.description:
I reported bin we put out for dog waste not being emptied. Seems it was emptied today but a number of pieces of waste tipped in street and not recovered not doubt to impress. Doesn't add to good residential conditions
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bryanston Mews West, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone dumped a toilet near our bins, 1st July
item.description:
Someone has dumped a toilet near our bins on the corner of 53 Addington Square , near the back of the tennis courts. Could this please be removed asapas It is a health and safety hazard . Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goodyear Place, Camberwell, London

item.title: Pile of bin bags not collected since Friday, 1st July
item.description:
The bin men seem to have forgotten to pick up the pile of bin bags they piled up on Friday. I think it’s a cause for concern for health and safety issues such as attracting vermin or kids and elderly. It’s also blocking the road since it dumped on the road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Caldecott Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Tree not correctly cut and not able to see from the road., 1st July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selsey Crescent, West Heath, London
